  physical_appearance: This is an embroidered set of wings symbolising the British Royal Air Force. It is capped by a crown
 and has outstretched wings on either side. The letters \u0027RAF\u0027 are embroided in the middle
 with a wreath bordering it. The wings are embroided with two shades of beige thread
 on a black base.

  sgcool_label_text: This embroidered set of RAF wings belonged to George Dudley Binsted
 who joined the Royal Air Force (RAF) in 1941 and had flown Spitfires over France before being posted to Java. After the fall of Singapore in February 1942
 Binsted along with four others
 were captured by the Japanese. They were transported by ship to Singapore
 where they spent the next three and a half years as POWs in Changi Prison. While in captivity
 Binsted created this set of RAF wings from scratch
 using scraps of thread he could find in prison.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is an embroidered set of wings symbolising the British Royal Air Force. It is capped by a crown, and has outstretched wings on either side. The letters 'RAF' are embroided in the middle, with a wreath bordering it. The wings are embroided with two shades of beige thread, on a black base.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This embroidered set of RAF wings belonged to George Dudley Binsted, who joined the Royal Air Force (RAF) in 1941 and had flown Spitfires over France before being posted to Java. After the fall of Singapore in February 1942, Binsted along with four others, were captured by the Japanese. They were transported by ship to Singapore, where they spent the next three and a half years as POWs in Changi Prison. While in captivity, Binsted created this set of RAF wings from scratch, using scraps of thread he could find in prison.
